reference_summary: Customer reports double charge; agent apologizes, verifies account digits, and promises to reverse duplicate charge with email confirmation.
Team reviews checkout redesign; engineer flags latency risk; designer will update error states; team targets next Wednesday ship with QA plan and prototypes.

Buyer objects to $1200/month; seller offers $1000 with a one-year term and white-glove onboarding; buyer demands capped overages; seller agrees to 20% cap and weekly alerts; buyer accepts and asks for the contract.

Customer escalates a two-day outage ticket; agent apologizes and pulls in a support lead; lead moves case to critical queue with hourly updates; customer insists on an update before noon and lead agrees.

Release slipped a week; engineer admits rushing flag migration; QA lacked timely builds; action items: engineer writes flag checklist, QA automates smoke tests, manager adds release cutoff dates to calendar and enforces them.
